intro: Prostanthera hirtula, commonly known as the hairy prostanthera, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are hairy and often have a mint-like scent, contributing to its medicinal uses. Prostanthera hirtula is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and woodlands.
